website_summaries.verdict: The perfect option for anyone wanting a sense of simplicity in their desk or office environment. Great looks meet practical functionality without a complicated setup.
pros: Dedicated space underneath the shelf is large enough for other computer peripherals, office supplies, or organizational containers
cons: Lacks specific convenience features like cord organization

customer_reviews.title: like me, who is looking to put their game ...
customer_reviews.text: To everyone who is wondering if a ps4 or an xbox one will fit under these stands, the answer is yes. The Xbox one fits perfectly underneath with a quarter to a half inch of breathing room on the top. Yes this is the jr stand, yes an xbox one fits under it. The ps4 fits no problem, plenty of room all around it. Hope this helps anyone, like me, who is looking to put their game systems under the stands.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as an Espresso Stand
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a stand that I could use to set my espresso machine and coffee grinder on. In searching for the perfect stand, I wanted it to do two things: 1) raise the espresso machine off the counter, and 2) allow me to store supplies underneath. When I ran across this one, I knew I had found the ideal piece. I've been using it for over a month and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: Seems very well made, even the top shelf is metal. Just a heads up: the shelf is not 19 inches wide as it says here, it is 18.5 inch wide which it says on the box. But, that is the external measurement. The internal width is about 17.5 inches as each leg is roughly a half inch wide. Likewise, the 5.25 height is external, the vertical clearance under the shelf is 4 5/8 inches, again, due to the width of the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perforated Metal sags under weight of monitor
customer_reviews.text: I like most things about it. Size, shape etc. The space underneath to store keyboard etc. I already have one similar to this one. The older one I have is much more sturdy than this one is however. The perforated top is thin and sags under the "weight" of a 24" monitor (that's really not all that heavy). It causes the stand of the monitor to have gaps on the sides so it moves around a bit too much. My old one has a heavier/larger 27" monitor on it and its rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment - warped piece of junk, monitor wobbles
customer_reviews.text: I've had several of these monitor stands before and never had any kind of an issue with them, but I got a second one to add a second monitor in my home office and to my surprise, it's a complete piece of junk. It's warped/concave and the monitor wobbles. It is nothing like the supposedly identical product I ordered years ago -- this was much lighter weight, lighter in color, and the metal is flimsy. There's zero chance it could hold 40 lbs. A single normal sized monitor is too much for it. I'm hoping this was a fluke and trying again, but it really seems like they cheaped out on materials and ruined a perfectly good product.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, and Useful for Laptops w/external Monitors
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height for use with my laptop computer and an external monitor. Otherwise, the laptop monitor obscures the external monitor, so this is an essential accessory for this purpose. Stand is well built and stable. It does sit flat on my desktop with no objectionable tilting one way or the other. Small storage space underneath is useful for cable management, and an external hard drive. Very functional and well designed. This is actually the second one of these that I've purchased, so that should tell you something. I have one at my work office, and one at my home office.
customer_reviews.author: JayV

customer_reviews.title: Doubles desktop space and raises monitor to eye level
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand is very handy. Not only does it raise my monitor to eye-level, but I can use the space underneath for keyboard storage. Not all of the stand is taken up by the monitor stand, so I can use the space for storing small items like a stabler, small external hard drive, post-it note pads, etc. I found this so handy, I ordered a second one to raise my telephone up off my desk and I store my Sharp EL-1801V color printing adding machine (aka calculator) underneath the stand where I can operate it without moving it. This stand is sturdy and well ventilated.
customer_reviews.author: MrData2

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and not stable
customer_reviews.text: The metal is very thin and it bows in the middle. My monitor was very stable and stood flat on my desk, but it wobbled like a Weeble on this thing. It flexes in the middle. I went to a retail store and took some very similar stands out of the boxes. All of these cheap one with the small holes all flex way too much. The monitors in the store would not stand up on any of them. I have a couple of heavier ones with the large holes and they function as expected.
customer_reviews.author: BobBoylston

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Others have already posted the dimensions, but here they are again: 17-1/8" x 12" x 4-1/2" (inner), 18-1/2" x 12" x 5-1/4" (outer) I'm very happy with this purchase. I'm using it to maximize space in my new media cabinet. It fits perfectly over my Samsung blu-ray player, which is about 17" wide. The shelf is more than wide/deep enough for the TiVo to sit up top.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Richard

customer_reviews.title: Get back some space back on your desk! Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: I use dual monitors on a small desk and would lose a lot of space with out these. I have tried plastic and 'wood' ones but I like how these look and function the best. I store small trays under them to hold small odd and ends I need handy. They are very sturdy and have room for other things on them under the screen. Also with their large size I was able to match the position on the sides of the desk and place the monitor the angle I needed (slightly different monitors with different bases)
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Top Is NOT FLAT and NOT LEVEL
customer_reviews.text: Exact size that I needed. Then I put my 23" monitor on it, which has a round base. The monitor rocks back and forth a substantial amount. Due to how the top metal plate is welded to the metal bars, it has a concave curve in its surface like a spoon. It's obvious that the welding warped and bent the surface out of shape. Very poorly manufactured due to where the welding points were placed.
customer_reviews.author: Tell It Like It Is IMO

customer_reviews.title: Great for posture. Nice place to store laptop.
customer_reviews.text: It's bad posture to look downward at your monitor while sitting at your desk. These raised my monitors high enough to be able to look at them with proper posture. I actually notice less back pain since I've started using them. On top of that, I love the way I can slide my laptop underneath it to be out of the way. Currently I have two stands set up both holding 24" monitors and they are working just fine. My laptop is tucked underneath one stand and my docking station is tucked under the other.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor stand!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these for my home office set up w/ dual 27” monitors. I purchased these junior stands instead of the regular-sized stand because I only need the stand for the monitor. The stands are metal, which makes them sturdy and stable. This is the second desk that I have used these stands for, and in both instances they worked great - good height. I also like that it gives you space under the monitor, so you can put like your keyboard, a notebook or files or whatever underneath. Would recommend to anyone looking for a simple and sturdy monitor stand.
customer_reviews.author: GE

customer_reviews.title: Super study, looks nice, vents are very useful
customer_reviews.text: If you want to lift up your laptop to eye level or a monitor, this is your best bet. The best part about it is it allows for you to place something underneath, such as your keyboard which helps free up some space on your desk. I'd recommend the larger one if you have the space since you could even use the left over on the stand as a shelf for a small lamp or something, plus the bottom space. I have a 15.6 inch 2018 HP Envy Pavillion on it and there's still good amount of space to put my wallet or small things on there.
customer_reviews.author: Ronaldo V.

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: my 29" wide screen monitor has a 16" wide base so I have to go with this stand with a wide base and it works fine. The only complain is the top panel material of the stand seems a little too thin because my monitor is not heavy compared to the advertised 50 lb but you still can see the top panel got pressed down a little bit by the weight and if you touch the stand the monitor will definitely shake a little bit - so a little more stable will make the stand perfect...
customer_reviews.author: cailiqingsheng

customer_reviews.title: Very functional and plan on buying another
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize the top is perforated. This is a nice surprise because I have a notebook on a docking station and I am using a cooling fan underneath the notebook. There is lots of air circulation around the notebook since I use this for working from home. Plenty of room to stash the regular keyboard underneath when not in use. The other configuration is I have put the notebook, docking station and cooling fan underneath with an extra monitor resting on the stand. Lots of room underneath for this configuration too.
customer_reviews.author: mac1319

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!!
customer_reviews.text: I am super pleased with this purchase. I have a Corner desk and Very limited space 2 monitors (main in the center corner in front of my large Pc tower, and second monitor to my Left and a ton of stuff to my Right i have yet to deal with :P ) as a growing Graphic Artist. i have to use my Drawing tablet often and use to use a Phone book to hold my Monitor up high.. and never had work space to put away my keyboard. Until I found this. I could not wait to put this on my desk. now i use it to tuck away my keyboard almost all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Singingfrog

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Looks Good, Good Space Underneath for a Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have 14 of these monitor stands for dual-screen use on company computers. They look good, are wide enough to put power managers and 17-inch laptops underneath, and the stand is very sturdy, no sagging or flexing with a 24-inch monitor on it. The stand has rubber feet to minimize slipping as well. I have tried other stands that bend and wobble, so these are my stand of choice now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy No Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I needed just a little extra storage space on my counter/furniture where I had my tvs. These shelves are ready to use right out of the box & were the perfect height, giving me about 6 inches storage space below the tvs for magazines, newspapers, etc. A word of caution though -- in one case the shelf raised the tv too much, resulting in a stiff neck before I realized what was causing it. No problem, though. I just switched the shelf & put it under my printer. Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Workstation Achieved
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of this product! It is great for someone looking for a more ergonomic workstation. If you find yourself slouching or struggling with how to sit and see your computer screens comfortably this is the product for you. It lifts your screens to just the right height so you are not stuck trying to sit your screens on various books or boxes to have your screens at eye level. Only downfall is that it isnt adjustable if you prefer slightly higher or lower. you would need to adjust your seat to get that type of angle wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable Monitor Stand.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand functions very well when it comes to managing the weight of heavy objects, without bending or breaking. The purpose for which I used this stand for was not necessarily for a monitor, but rather a console of mines. I placed my PlayStation 3 Fat on top of this stand, as opposed to putting it underneath the bottom. My primary reason for doing this was to help provide proper airflow to my system, while also keeping it elevated from a major source of heat that the stand itself now makes direct contact with. In the end though, this monitor stand is one that I would definitely recommend for long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Dude

customer_reviews.title: Versatile riser
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a stand for a toaster oven that would replace our 30 year old under cabinet Black and Decker. It works for the original oven (Panasonic Xpress) we'd purchased and also for its replacement. I would have given it 5 stars except that it was not completely level--an issue much more noticeable with the lighter weight oven sitting directly on the stand. We now have a roll-type oven with a base just slightly too big, but, using a granite cutting board, we were able to fit the oven and provide enough weight to level out the stand.
customer_reviews.author: A RHEA

customer_reviews.title: Better Than a Laptop Cooling Fan
customer_reviews.text: If you look online, a lot of people will recommend vacuum coolers or laptop cooling stands, but most of time a laptop only needs space to vent the air flow below. I've used the stand with 2 different heavy gaming laptops and undervolted to get great performance with significantly better temps than just using laptop fan with a 1-2 degree difference. Some laptops just need more space to exhaust air below. If you have keyboard and mouse set less than 18 inches long you could also place it underneath the stand comfortably on the desk below.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid product, with minimal complaints
customer_reviews.text: Overall I does its job. Not only does it prop my monitor up stably, it also provide space where I can put my PS4 underneath. There are frictional pads under the bars so it doesn't slide around at My only complaint would be these two things: 1) You cannot adjust height. Sadly one of my monitor's height is not adjustable, so I'm pretty much locked at the stand's added height. The only way around this would be to raise/lower my table, or add books underneath the monitor (but then again I can't lower it). 2) It doesn't look very appealing. Granted this isn't aimed towards aesthetics, but I feel that they could've done a better design for the product.
customer_reviews.author: kevbev89

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING TURNS MY MONITOR INTO A BOBBLEHEAD! NOT STABLE AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: This thing out the box came out looking cheap! The actual flat surface where the monitor goes is big time dent in. The legs at the bottom don't sit flush at all. I'm going back to cardboard box rather then using this. Yes the cardboard box is more steady!
customer_reviews.author: B.RAM

customer_reviews.title: One of the best investments I've made this year
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments I've made this year. The lift this stand gives my monitor is great. It's so much better than having to hunch over. And being able to store the keyboard underneath gives me extra room on the desktop. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Monica S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: My husband upgraded my home office and installed a switch so that I can alternate between working on my work-issued Dell laptop and my personal MacBook. Getting dual monitors, the keyboard and mouse, the switch, and two docked laptops to fit on the desk was a challenge. I used this stand over my docked Dell Latitude laptop and placed my MacBook above it. The stand is extremely sturdy and I like that the air holes allow ventilation for both laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a place to put my laptop when it is docked at my desk and I didn't have room for that and my printer. My laptop is a 17 inch monitor (makes it about 19 inches wide). I put the printer on this stand and the laptop fits underneath perfectly. The stand is extremely sturdy. The printer is about 30 lbs and there is no give in the stand at all. Extremely happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable, perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. I have 2 larger ones I purchased about a year ago and I just purchased this smaller one for the laptop itself. These keep the monitors at a perfect height, which keeps my posture in perfect alignment. My bad neck and back really appreciate the assistance these shelves provide in my office space (where I spend way too much time). I highly recommend these for anyone working with monitors needing a taller adjustment than they can get with the monitor stand itself. Also provides additional desk space!
customer_reviews.author: Stina

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a 24" computer monitor. It is sturdy and a great space saver. It stands 4" tall and 14.5" wide. It is the most effective and practical computer stand I could find for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Does the job... great for dual laptops.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for dueling laptops. Not sufficiently wide to place a keyboard underneath, but laptops (normal sized, NOT oversized developer laptops with keypad) fit fine (i have two of different sizes). ...or laptop with monitor on top. study, well-made... but could use a little rubberizing on the legs, to keep it from slipping on shiny desk.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Monster Monitor and Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have a rather heavy 43" computer monitor that I purchased for my new laptop (PC replacement) and was looking for a stand that could handle the weight. When I received this I was delighted to find that my laptop fit neatly within the open space, although I had to put it on a piece of plywood to raise it the roughly 1/2 inch needed for the connections to clear the support arms. There is even room on the top shelf for my docking station and external DVD drive. This is a very sturdy item and I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: tillyny

customer_reviews.title: PC Slides Underneath....Screen now at perfect height
customer_reviews.text: I looked long and hard to find something that would have room underneath for my Lenovo Work Station and to get screen, off the top of it and a bit higher so I could have perfect alignment for eyesight. Taaaahhhh! Dahhhhh! This was the ticket. This pup is sturdy...built well and did the trick. Looks Great too!
customer_reviews.author: J. rosan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One, I have had for more than two years. Nice looking, sturdy and the added desk space is a plus. Works great as a monitor riser (although not height adjustable) it was the perfect adjustment for my monitor. My other one is used on my desk at home for a lamp and a speaker to provide desk top space. I also saw someone using it as an espresso/coffee station with k-cups, etc. stored underneath. Very versatile and useful for many things.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie N. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition
customer_reviews.text: As I am working from home, I had the laptop and monitor positioned at different heights. Forgot about this handy, dandy product and immediately ordered from Amazon. It is the right height and size for my desk. Like the space under the stand to store items that need to be within reach. Excellent addition to my teleworkstation.
customer_reviews.author: Helene Klusmann

customer_reviews.title: FOR ME, IT DESERVES SIX STARS
customer_reviews.text: Every now and then, you find a gadget that fits your needs perfectly. Such is the case with this monitor stand. It's the exact height and width I've been looking for, with just the right tilt. My external card reader and USB port hub fit comfortably on the stand and there is ample room beneath it for, alternately, my graphics tablet or keyboard. It's metal and seems solidly built; I wish my monitor stand was as sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: K. JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Well made, no assembly required
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to allow for some ventilation space in my parents' modest AV set up. This arrived fully assembled and the fit and finish look better than one of the comparable knock-offs, where the screws extend out quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Vandergriff

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for correcting laptop hunching.
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love this thing. I have a 15" Retina Macbook Pro and after YEARS of hunching over at the desk I finally got around to raising my laptop up to alleviate neck pain and bad posture. I have a wireless mouse and keyboard, but I'm still using the laptop keyboard, which is forcing me to sit up straighter and keep my head and neck straighter. The Mac sits just about perfect on the stand, with just a tiny little overhang on the edges, but the bottom pads of the laptop are firmly planted. It feels solidly made for the price but is still lightweight and easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor stand for small to large screens.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor stand works great! It brings my monitor up to the perfect height. If you are a very tall person you may want to find a stand with a higher setting. But for the average person I don't see why this wouldn't work. I can keep my tape dispenser, post-its and other random office items in the area beneath the stand to help keep my desk organized. It's very sturdy! Even if I bump my desk my monitor is secure. The platform is wide enough to fit larger computer screens. I have a 20" screen and there is plenty of room and more for the base of the screen.
customer_reviews.author: CSteinrock

customer_reviews.title: Old reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I've got two of these in my house now. One of them is supporting a 22" Vizio TV/monitor and the other is supporting a 47" Vizio HDTV that has to weight at least 50-60lbs. These things are very sleek looking at do not stand out AT ALL. They almost hid under your monitor while giving it that little raise that it needs to be eye-level. I'd recommend them to anyone looking for an affordable, minimalist monitor stand that will do exactly what is needed with no other frills or drawbacks. (also you can slide your keyboard under it which is awesome!)
customer_reviews.author: Zantos

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: this is a very sturdy stand for my work laptop. I use a lenovo thinkpad x240 at work and it fits very well on this stand. I like the holes that it has so my laptop has good ventilation. Depending on what surface I put it on it will be at a decent to great height for me to work from. The only flaw I saw was that one of the gummy pads was missing from the bottom of the stand when I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Jcruz1000

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: The stand is sturdy. My only reservation is that I have this on top of a stand-up desk, and with movement the stand tends to vibrate a bit due to its lack of support on the front - open at the front without front legs. I generally find this unnoticeable, but occasionally it catches my attention. If you are on a sturdy surface like a desk, then there will be no issues at all. Overall well constructed, attractive, functional.
customer_reviews.author: Reid

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey, but very much worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: These were a little expensive, but believe me worth the cost. Especially if you are like me and are 6'5". Your neck and shoulders get so sore from being hunched over a monitor all day, and this allows you to sit back, open your lungs, and look up to the screen. I have been recommending to clients for years to use a few phonebooks (that no one uses anymore anyway) under the monitor to improve your posture. Has drastically improved my neck and shoulder pain, and makes working all day on a PC a much better experience. These are very sturdy, and even with my clumsiness bumping into my desk and such, the monitors stay very stable and barely move.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rad

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect for stacking XBoxes!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent stand -- and so very sturdy! I have more than one. One for storing my keyboard under the desktop and another in my son's room for his gaming consoles. The XBox One goes on top and the XBox 360 tucks perfectly into the space at the bottom. Neither have overheated after a year of use - the holes and just enough room between the two for enough air to circulate to keep them nice and cool. Would HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is so simple, yet it works perfectly. I got the silver one, which is a dark nickel silver, not green as others suggested. It arrived promptly and in perfect shape. My keyboard easily slips onto the extended legs, out of the way, when I need to use my desk for paperwork. Best of all, it holds a magnet. So I have a horizontal magnetic surface to tack business cards, notes, etc., which used to wander all around my desk. One very small problem: my wide footed monitor rocked slightly on it, but I just put an extra mouse pad under it and that solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Works as a laptop stand
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows a monitor on the stand, but I use this for my laptop. This is a very sturdy shelf and a wider laptop (mine is 15 inches) sets on top securely. There are holes on the supporting stand which allows for air circulation and keeps the laptop cool. I do not type on the laptop in this position but I have an ergonomic keyboard plugged into it. The height of the laptop screen is just right when on top of the stand. I like the space under the shelf for various misc materials. The space between the supports is 13.5 inches, so I can put notebooks or even a ream of printer paper underneath.
customer_reviews.author: G Moxie

customer_reviews.title: Monitor stand and platform.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these years ago and it holds my TV without any trouble, so I ordered one again when I needed anther one to hold my other TV. The stands are sturdy and last forever while holding what would seem to be quite a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sprkymrt

customer_reviews.title: Great for stackng stereo components.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for stacking computer components, e.g., receivers and disc players. They are plenty big and strong for my Pioneer VSX-1131 and Oppo UDP-203 with the receiver on top. Very solid construction and pretty good looks. Might not work for deeper units such as Pioneer Elite Receivers. Don't know why they aren't advertised for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: J. Green

customer_reviews.title: VERY Sturdy Stand
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to hold my very heavy and very wide printer....and it does exactly that! I love this stand and how dependable it is. There is very little shaking from it when I'm printing, and that was 1 important factor for me (to keep it). I love it! No regrets of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JAMMY1Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Slides more than a slip and slide
customer_reviews.text: Now while I really like how this is saving me from becoming the next hunchback of notre dome I do want to point out a huge flaw for this monitor stand is that it slips and slides all over on my counter. The little white "silicon " stoppers are just there for show. They do not grip onto the surface as it should. At. All. I just lost some important files that have have to redo again because the stand slowly was moving to the left and toppled off the edge of my table.
customer_reviews.author: Sosin

customer_reviews.title: Nice White Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: Took a star for being slightly overpriced. $24.95 for the white one. This is a very simple piece of painted metal, probably should be priced around $15-20. Otherwise, I'm happy with it. Looks decent and is a great height to help my neck from being sore from looking down. I'm a tall dude.
customer_reviews.author: J. Revell

customer_reviews.title: great for LG w2246
customer_reviews.text: needed something to raise the monitor since at work they gave us docking station for our laptops, the Allsop Large Metal Monitor Stand has provided enough space to accommodate my lenovo ThinkPad completely under it. also since is wide i was able to put some personal touches like a small photo of my wife. will buy another one for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Silva (MajinGunplero)

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stand to put under my 37" flat screen TV so the TV would be above my soundbar. It works perfectly and blends in nicely. This is a solid stand. My only caution would be to anyone trying to fit an object longer than the stand;s length underneath the stand. The measurements are based on the outside points and do NOT take into consideration the loss of almost a full inch created by the round tube stand "feet." Not a problem for me, but could be frustrating if you think your 4" soundbar will fit - because it won't!
customer_reviews.author: RixStix founderTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Uneven legs, wobbled terribly, returned for replacement
customer_reviews.text: Update: so far so good with the replacement. It has no issues and works as it should. First shelf recieved: The angle of the legs was mismatched between sides making the stand wobble and unusable. Returned for replacement since overall the shelf seems strong and well made. Perhaps this one managed to sneak past quality control somehow. :)
customer_reviews.author: The Reluctant Audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Spite the laws of the natural universe!
customer_reviews.text: Does your computer monitor rest on your desk, succumbing to cruel forces of gravity? Mine sure did. In fact, I had to use a Terrestrial phone book to prop my screen up high enough to view it without piercing next strain. No longer with this product. Once I received my Allsop Monitor Stand and relieved my tired phone book from its duty. I was amazed that not only could I elevate my 24" wide screen monitor to a comfortable height, but also store desk equipment underneath it! I keep expecting the sorcerous magic to exhaust its resources one of these days, tumbling my monitor back onto my desk, but after months of operation, it's still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E. Burnes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 27 inch Mac
customer_reviews.text: I wanted space unearth my Mac and this is great. I love the open front to allow larger items to occasionally get stuffed in it. LOL!! VERY STURDY - I gently placed the Mac on it and it did not give at all.
customer_reviews.author: Downsizing Girl

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few years now and it's still holding up great! Put my non-adjustable monitor at just the right height! Easy to assembly! Allows for a bit of storage underneath also! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Ericka ZW

customer_reviews.title: Great for monitors and TVs
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to set my 32" flat screen TV on that wouldn't add too much height but that would add enough height for the cable box to fit underneath. After looking for quite some time I decided to give this stand a try and I'm glad I did! It is very sturdy and I am not at all worried about the 32" (25.4 lbs) TV I have sitting on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy D. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, simple and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for our pupose. Can easily accommodate a laptop mounted on a docking station. There is also enough room underneath to put your notes and papers. Excellent make and nice color
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye83

customer_reviews.title: Yes, a PS3 or PS4 will fit perfectly underneath!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice stand. Would work for a monitor, but I think it's better as an electronics stand for a cable receiver or video game system. I have limited room in my entertainment center for cable boxes, etc. We were putting the cable box on top of the ps4, but I didn't like how hot it was getting. This solves the problem perfectly! My Ps4 fits perfectly under the stand, with about 2 and 1/2 inches of clearance above it for air. Then I put my cable box on top of the stand, and all is well! Looks nice, made of quality materials, and solved my problem perfectly. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: amazon_138

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was even taller/great for very short people
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this! Very sturdy and looks nice in the white color. Overall I wish this was taller though, I'm only 5'1" and still have to look down more than I would like to, so I can't imagine what it's like for those who are average height or taller.
customer_reviews.author: Zoë Chmielewski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size and Position for Standing or Sitting
customer_reviews.text: I like to stand at my desk, and needed a new laptop stand as I reluctantly gave my old one to my mom. This very affordable stand works like a charm; my laptop sits securely and at the right position for standing or sitting. Also, kudos to Allsop for the vented flat surface. There is just enough storage underneath for me to put those papers that need my immediate attention which keeps the piles on my desk at bit more at a minimum. Just wish it came in white...
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop stand for using on couch
customer_reviews.text: Turn this backwards, pull off the Allsop logo sticker with a pair of pliers so it doesn't catch on your clothes, and this is the best laptop stand I have ever found for using on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: User312938

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a platform for my computer monitor so that I can sit with a straight back while I work. I'm extremely tall, and this raises my monitor to an appropriate height. The metal material feels very high quality and substantial, and it has nice rubber pads on the legs to sit softly and securely on the desk. The legs are wide enough apart that I can easily slide my Intuos Pro Wacom tablet under it when I'm not using it, which is a huge quality of life bonus. I'll probably get the small version for my laptop which sits next to my primary monitor. A+
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Also good for laptops
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this stand to get my 17" laptop screen at about the same height as my 22" monitor. The stand has rubber feet that keep it in one place on the desktop and easily takes the weight of the laptop. I find the curved legs particularly useful as I keep a keyboard underneath the laptop and the mouse to the right side of the stand. The curved feet allow me to move my hand from the keyboard to the mouse without needing to go around a leg in the front right. I've you're going to keep a keyboard underneath it, make sure it will fit. There's 17.5" of space available between the legs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Large Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this stand for a home office I set up since I've been working from home during the coronavirus pandemic. This is the perfect size to set my laptop on with my keyboard underneath it. Prior to having this stand, my laptop didn't fit in my desk with my keyboard. The open front design is perfect for this kind of setup (with the keyboard under the screen) and has improved the hight if my laptop screen so I can work with better posture.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Young

customer_reviews.title: Well-built quality desk stand
customer_reviews.text: Great desk stand that I use to put my laptop on along with a three monitor setup. Well-built, has a good amount of weight to it, and stays still on my desk. I wouldn't recommend this as a laptop stand if you need to use your laptop's trackpad and keyboard as the stand is raised 3-4 inches off of the base, but since I use a wireless keyboard and mouse this isn't much of an issue. I've been using this stand daily for nearly two years and it's still in mint condition. Definitely recommend for your dream desk setup!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product that's sturdy and does what it's supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: A quality stand that I personally use to hold my Dell S2417DG as well as put my PS4 pro underneath. And if anyone is curious, yes, this will definitely fit your console as it did with my PS4 Pro with some space to spare on the sides. I was concerned that there wouldn't be enough side space, but using this definitely stopped those fears. Good quality product that's sturdy and does what it's supposed to do at a great value. Awesome job!
customer_reviews.author: KSong

customer_reviews.title: Looks like and does just what it says.
customer_reviews.text: I use this little stand to prevent neck cramps as I'm often on the computer for hours at a time. It's a good way to prevent this by changing the position of your head. However, for those who want to stand while they work, it doesn't raise the computer high enough for that, if it's on a regular height desk. It has padded tabs on the bottom to keep the metal from rubbing your wood finish and the top is covered with holes for ventilation. It's very sleek and utilitarian looking. My furniture is more traditional, so I placed a place mat on top which provided an attractive surface as my laptop didn't require the ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Gal

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product and I am glad to go with this one instead of other product with higher price. This stand is stand is sturdy and strong, I am not afraid of sagging although I am putting my quite heavy dell monitor and Asus monitor (I have 2 of this stand, I bought one, once it arrives I bought another one.) I definitely recommend this stand if you're looking for "dumb" monitor stand. I will upload photos asap.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Stand
customer_reviews.text: I received this about 2 days ahead of the scheduled delivery time, and it has been a great help thus far! As advertised, it raises your device 4" above the desktop, so that has helped greatly with ergonomics. Instead of looking down at the laptop, I have been able to look at it head-on. As a note, I have been using a 17" MacBook Pro with this stand, and in order for me to "fit" it on the stand, I have had to use a laptop riser on the top area. For people who have a 15" laptop, those devices should fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: The Builder

customer_reviews.title: big help for neck problems
customer_reviews.text: I sit at my computer screen for about 6 hours a day, and my bad posture, hunched over my monitor, aggravates my long-standing pain in my neck. (My monitor stand tilts, but does not allow for a change in elevation.) This stand raises the monitor 4" off my desk, which is just enough to change the viewing angle; I noticed an improvement in the stiffness/pain in my neck after just one day. An added bonus: I now have a small shelf on either side of my monitor for post-it notepad, stereo remote, etc., plus an open space underneath for papers in my "to do" pile. This is the best bang-for-the-buck office product investment I've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Costero

customer_reviews.title: Good but some flaws
customer_reviews.text: The product is seems good but you may encounter some problem. 1. The stand is not symetrical 2. The surface is somehow bent on the edges. Those are the problems i have encountered. Good but not as expected. I wish I can switch with the better one. I have to use a thin book to make it stable. Would recommend if they fix the problem
customer_reviews.author: Ardi Thenggono

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Put my lap tap on it and plenty ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Put my lap tap on it and plenty of room underneath to keep an additional keyboard on the two lower legs which also gives me room to slide a spiral writing notebook under the keyboard. Works perfect for my needs. The quality is very well made. Should last years. No chipping or pealing of the finish. I actually bought another one for a computer on my other desk.
customer_reviews.author: malinda

customer_reviews.title: A great stand for small to medium monitors.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small gaming area set up in my attic. I use this stand to elevate a 22" monitor. It suites my needs perfectly, The stand is very study and the contemporary industrial design looks great. Because of the open design, I'm able to use the area underneath the stand for addition desktop space. This is a great stand for the price and I recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable stand.
customer_reviews.author: Cory B.

customer_reviews.title: stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, great for organization around your workspace at home (desk) or even around your stero or other similar place, Built well and clean simple design.
customer_reviews.author: JoeAverage-User

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stand for my Laptop since I only use it as a monitor. I have a separate keyboard. I noticed a difference almost immediately with my posture by the end of day 1. I read reviews and looked at many different stands online. This one is very simple, packaging was good and no assembly required.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: The stand is a simple sturdy design, and the mesh top keeps the laptop ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to hold my laptop computer which is connected to a full size keyboard, mouse, and an additional 21" flat screen monitor. The height of the stand is just right, and monitors line up well. You can put your keyboard under the laptop when you are not using it. With this type of configuration you have the benefits of a full size dual monitor desktop computer with the portability of a laptop. The stand is a simple sturdy design, and the mesh top keeps the laptop from overheating.
customer_reviews.author: FrequentAmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: This stand is perfect size wise and is also well made
customer_reviews.text: when Verizon FIOS replaced one of my set top boxes with a new one that was much smaller I had a problem - I needed some kind of stand to put my 32" flat screen TV on that would elevate it enough to put the set top box underneath and still provide airflow around it. It also had to be small enough to fit on top of the small chest that holds the TV and set top box. This stand is perfect size wise and is also well made, sturdy and unobstrusive. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amelia P.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for durability.
customer_reviews.text: At this time of writing, the silver was the best value metallic monitor stand for the price. We use it for our laptops + keyboard and occasionally a 27 inch monitor and it's always supported them faithfully. Not height adjustable may be an issue for some, but I did not have any problems adjusting my seat to be ergonomically perfect. Amazon is rolling out an Amazonbasics stand similar to this one. See my other review for how it stacks up in quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Wanted something to keep my laptop cool, ventilation, as it runs all day, this fit the purpose of my purchase. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Space saver
customer_reviews.text: I am able to put my keyboard away under the stand when not in use and raise my monitors to eye level to minimize strain to neck and back.
customer_reviews.author: Juan G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly over my xbox 360 holding up my xbox one so they don't overheat. They also fit the reverse way, but I just prefer the One on top. I can't think of any way to improve on it, or anything to complain about. My 360 has shut off before during a heavy run of Windows Media Center streaming because of overheating, and since I got this, that is no longer an issue. Great product for a great price. Totally recommend if you are in the same boat.
customer_reviews.author: C. S.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your laptop cool and your head up
customer_reviews.text: I tend to hung forward to look down at my computer during my desk job so I wanted something that could elevate my screen. Not only did this stand elevate my screen, but is perforated so it kept my laptop cool as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B.

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving it three stars because it functions perfectly
customer_reviews.text: However, the color is NOT as depicted in the provided photo. It's not a nice shiny silver. It's more of a dull ugly grey. It's kinda hard to explain, but I think someone else posted their own pictures and that's basically what it really looks like. Other than that, this stand works well. It fits my 22" monitor on top and my PS3 slim on the bottom just about right. The elevation is decent. The height measures exactly 4" from the bottom to the very top surface, but the actual clearance height underneath is a little less than 3.5" just so you know.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: A Great, Sturdy Metal Stand For Your Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, I was worried my ASUS MG279Q would be a snug fit, but it has plenty of room with it's ginormous baseplate. Elevating my desktop screen has allowed me to put I/O devices such as my Line 6 POD UX1 and a center speaker underneath, so that's pretty much the reason I bought it. It does precisely what it was built to do, it's not a piece of junk so I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and useful! My laptop sits perfectly on top and plenty of room under the stand to store items! Very sturdy and well made. Looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: and would have been a perfect solution if it wasn't for the fact that metal ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is well built and solid, and would have been a perfect solution if it wasn't for the fact that metal mesh of the shelf is NOT level. The shelf dips down in the center and causes my monitor to sit cockeyed, so I had to place spacers under the base to make it appear level again. It was so close, but just missed the mark with an apparent lack of quality control. J.D. Denver, CO.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer-B-Where?

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Laptop sits nicely on top of Allsop Large Metal Art Monitor Stand (18-Inch wide platform holds 50 lbs) & keyboard stores underneath until I need it.
customer_reviews.author: HappyBunny913

customer_reviews.title: Great little monitor stand.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to raise my monitor at work due to neck issues causing headaches. This raised it a reasonable height and now I'm no longer looking down at my monitor. My previous position had adjustable monitors, but I was not so lucky when I promoted. As a bonus, I can store my stapler, tape dispenser and post it notes underneath so it helps keep my desk organized as well. It's not fancy, but it serves its purpose great.
customer_reviews.author: Misty L.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: The color of the stand isn't black, its more like dark silver. It looks nice but I would have preferred black. I pulled the ugly logo off the front and it looks a lot better now. I'm using it to hold a Xbox One S over my PS4 and it works great for that. The legs aren't quite parallel to each other but a little bending might fix it but for the price I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby D

customer_reviews.title: Frees up tons of desktop. Perfect monitor height. Strong!  Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Frees up tons of desktop. Perfect monitor height. Strong! Great quality! Would definitely buy them again with no hesitation. Perfect place to get my Scotch tape roller, stapler, extra printer paper, KVM, organizer tray containg extra pens/highlighters/paperclips, and numerous ugly cables., On top, in addition to monitors, I fit a speaker & lamp, too.
customer_reviews.author: Solaris Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great for laptops & adding surface space to work area
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Very sturdy, good quality. Have 3 in my house. Two are under 2 laptops, provides good ventilation to keep them cool. Handy for storing the external keyboard under it. (I don't use the onboard keyboard on my laptops.) I use a 3rd one simply for maximizing desk space. I can lay papers, mail, etc. that I'm working on on top of it, while still accessing the stapler, tape dispenser, TV remote, etc. that I keep under it.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.text: The photo for this item suggests it'll have a brushed-metal finish, but it's actually gray paint. Nice glossy gray paint. The finish and condition of the stand I received are perfect, and the size is ideal for bringing my laptop screen up to eye level. It'll hold a 15" laptop with no problem, and provides plenty of room underneath for cables, a drawing tablet, or even a small keyboard (without a numeric keypad). The stand is sturdy and wobble-free, and has little silicone feet on the bottom tubing so it won't scratch your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Bull

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS STAND FOR MY LAPTOP!!! After what seemed an eternity of searching and reading hundreds of reviews, this excellent product saved my sanity. It is light weight, very sturdy, does not slip or slide around, takes up very little space, laptop sits at perfect eye-level, room under shelf for keyboard and/or keeping mouse and accessories, VERY AFFORDABLE!
customer_reviews.author: <NightOwlGal>

customer_reviews.title: I was a little skeptic that this tiny stand would be able to hold a 22" monitor but the Allsop stand is STURDY. The small footpr
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick perfectly! I was a little skeptic that this tiny stand would be able to hold a 22" monitor but the Allsop stand is STURDY. The small footprint means that I got a lot of my desk back. Under the stand, there is room for my stapler, tape dispenser, surge protector, and more. The pearl black is a neat color (and it costs more than plain silver) but if you are expecting black, you will be disappointed. Hubby has two of the larger stands and has been using them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Panda's Heart

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: I wish the top had a few silicon dots like the bottom because the laptop did slip when I was typing . I also wish it was a little slant Forward to make typing easier . It is sturdy the metal cut is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and was well packaged. I've got a seventeen inch lap top on top of this thing and it's just the right size; leaving about an inch on both sides. I use a desk top keyboard for the sensory response so I don't deal with any of the vibration problems but I can see how that's a possible design flaw if I were to try to use the laptop keyboard with it resting on this stand. For the price it was exactly what I'm looking for. The only downside is the ALLSOP silver logo on the front. It's an eye sore against the brushed black metal.
customer_reviews.author: Skay

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good product, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like the storage area beneath the shelf. I have an external monitor on it which hooks up to my laptop to make it more like a desktop while I'm working. Unfortunately, the shelf bounces just enough to annoy me while working. It does its job though. The only thing I really wish is that it was a bit wider. I'm using a thick catalog to rest my laptop on under the shelf right now because the hook-up for the monitor won't fit unless the laptop is raised a bit (by like an inch).
customer_reviews.author: JC Emery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy I ordered this stand out of all the choices. It was the best, and a very good value. It doesn't slide around as the legs have something on the bottom to prevent it. Even when I try to pull it forward, it stays. It's very sturdy, doesn't bow from weight on top and doesn't take up a lot of space on my desk. I love that it also allows for storage underneath. It was a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: BarbaraBee

product_meta.title: Allsop Large Metal Art Monitor Stand, 18-Inch wide platform holds 50 lbs with keyboard storage space - Black (30336)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Large Monitor StandThe Metal Art Large laptop/monitor stand features a clean and timeless design that raises your laptop or monitor to a comfortable and ergonomically correct viewing height. Forged from steel and powder coated, it provides a sturdy shelf for your laptop, monitor, TV or printer. Additionally, there's space beneath for your keyboard or other office supplies and electronics. The Allsop Metal Art curved steel monitor stand was designed in the USA by engineers in Bellingham, WA and was the first and original curved metal monitor stand to be introduced and sold in North America. The Allsop Metal Art series of products continues to be of the highest quality and popularity with over one million units sold.
feature_bullets: Clean modern design raises your monitor 5.25 inch to a comfortable and ergonomically correct viewing height to reduce neck strain
Great for monitors, laptops, printers, TVs, gaming consoles, DVD players, stereos upto 50 lbs/22 kg
Unique design allows for keyboard to slide underneath platform, keeping it out of the way when not in use
Made of powder coated steel with perforated hole pattern for passive airflow. Keeps your electronics cool
Non-skid protective feet will not scuff furniture
Great accessory for standing desks to ensure healthy ergonomic posture
Large sturdy platform measures 18 in (w) x 10 in (d)
Product Dimensions 18.5 in (l) x 12.25 in (d) x 5.25 in (h)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,150 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
